subject: AI & Agents
title: Data Augmentation: More Data from Less
description: A micro-lesson that makes Data Augmentation: More Data from Less usable.

hook.text: You have 1,000 images. You need 100,000. Augmentation is your multiplier.

buildup.text: Augmentation creates variations: flips, rotations, crops, color jitter, blur.

discovery.text: The model sees each augmented version as a new example, learning to ignore irrelevant changes.

twist.text: Over-augment and you create unrealistic images the model wastes capacity learning.

climax.text: Match augmentations to real-world variation. If cameras shake, add blur. If lighting varies, jitter.

punchline.text: Teach the model what doesn't matter.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of data augmentation?
options: Create training variations so the model generalizes better
